meanings.definition: One who talks rapidly and unintelligibly.
meanings.sent1: The jabberer in class never stopped talking.
meanings.sent2: The children giggled at the jabberer's nonsensical stories.
meanings.sent3: The jabberer at the party had everyone laughing with his endless chatter.
meanings.sent4: The radio host was a jabberer, filling the airwaves with constant chatter.
meanings.sent5: The little girl was known as the jabberer of the family, always sharing her thoughts.

meanings.sent1: During the meeting, he would jabberer on about random topics.
meanings.sent2: She tends to jabberer when she's nervous.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to jabberer after hearing the family talk all day.
meanings.sent4: The engine started to jabberer loudly, indicating a problem.
meanings.sent5: The excited fans began to jabberer with excitement as their favorite band took the stage.
